Replace.Text: The Palace has an extra slot for a [ICON_GreatWork_Portrait][ICON_GreatWork_Landscape][ICON_GreatWork_Religious][ICON_GreatWork_Sculpture] Great Work of Art. The Atelier improvement generates +1 [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist points per turn when adjacent to three or more resources. Recruiting a [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist awards an [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspiration.

The Palace and Government Plaza buildings have a [ICON_GreatWork_Portrait][ICON_GreatWork_Landscape][ICON_GreatWork_Religious][ICON_GreatWork_Sculpture] Great Work of Art slot. The Atelier improvement generates +1 [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist points per turn when adjacent to three or more resources. Recruiting a [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist awards an [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspiration.

Row.Text: Lydie & Suelle Malen, your strong bond and deep capacity for empathy are your greatest assets in running the greatest atelier in the kingdom for the good of everyone. Use the worlds you create in your mysterious paintings to inspire a better world for your civilization.
Lydie & Suelle
Lydie & Suelle Malen
Promise with Mom Number 27! "When you want to have fun, don't hold anything back!"

She’s the calm and quiet older twin sister of Suelle. She’s known for having a unique sense of art. She's from a small Atelier located in the capital city of Adalett, called Merveille. She is the more stable out of the two twins and looks after her younger sister. The two dream to one day run the kingdom's top atelier. She isn't very good at physical exercise, but is good at studying. She's social and kind, carefree and does things at her own pace. However, sometimes she can be a bit of an airhead. As a playable character she is more inclined towards support and healing. She is also more frail than her twin sister.

Suelle Malen is the opposite of her twin sister, Lydie, as an energetic girl who is more of a tomboy but dislikes bugs. She's from a small Atelier located in the capital city of Adalett, called Merveille. She and her sister dreams to one day run the kingdom's top atelier. She is the younger of the two and often teases her older sister, and is generally careless. However, she does appear to be a genius. As a playable character, Suelle is more robust and offensive-mannered than her sister.
We're Lydie and Suelle, alchemist-artists who run the greatest atelier in all the kingdom, for the good of everyone. Let's get along.
Join us at our atelier for a refreshing plate of puni jelly?
Okay.
Our mysterious paintings are windows into fantastical worlds of all types. How'd you like to tour the gallery?
Come in.
Your delegation was escorted through the Gates of Merk to nap in the flowerful Garden of Merk. It must've been an exhausting trip.
We don't want your ill-begotten gifts.
Our delegate is eager to deliver a set of personally-synthesized dream paintbrushes wrapped in spirit weave cloth.
Be careful out there. Adalet is home to hordes of ferocious beasts.
You're too seedy for our city.
We're out in search of inspiration. Could we please tote our easel through your lands?
Promise with Mom Number 27: 'When you want to have fun, don't hold anything back!'
Promise with Mom Number 5: 'Stay away from strange people!'
More friends means more occasions to have friends over for sweets and tea. How about it?
Hooray!
Boo.
You can't pull off a combination art without an ally. We'll be yours.
If you remove your military from our borders now we'll remember Promise with Mom Number 7: 'Sometimes pretend you didn't see anything.'
Yep.
Don't be a cole-pincher.
Have you gotten into our paints? Those aren't for eating.
You're an inky blot upon the world. We're all but convinced you escaped the Black Horizon. (Denounces You.)
If you think you've caught us unprepared, you haven't seen us synthesize in battle.
Someone has to be the one to free your citizens from tyranny. We just happen have a cache of N/A bombs.
Phew. Good thing we packed a few mystery elixirs.
We still have an all-in super-bomb with your name on it.
Let's synthesize peace.
Of all the worlds in our mysterious paintings, we couldn't account for the harshness of this one...
Don't worry. We'll find a place for you in one of our paintings.
Empathetic Twins
Lydie & Suelle want their citizens to enjoy happy lives, and expect the same from other civilizations.
(Your citizens are happy.)
Lydie & Suelle like civs with a happy population.
(Your citizens are unhappy.)
Lydie & Suelle dislike civs with an unhappy population.
We attended the festival that your citizens recently threw in your honor. You really seem to care for their well-being.
Leaders who can't empathize with the plight of their citizens should abdicate.
